com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.archetypes: (This card cannot be used at official tournaments.)
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Blastoise-EX.
Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Charizard-EX.
Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.
Each player turns all of his or her Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)
Shuffle 2 cards from your hand into your deck. (If you can't shuffle 2 cards into your deck, you can't play this card.) Then, draw a card.
Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Pidgeot-EX.
Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. Your turn ends.
Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Slowbro-EX.
Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.
Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Venusaur-EX.
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.decks.pcds: Mewtwo is ready to dish out the chaos! With Hitmonchan and Onix delivering quick hits, this deck clobbers both body and mind. You'll be right in the thick of the action!

Charge up your game with the little thunderbolt that never gives up: Pikachu! Add the electrifying power of Raichu and the supercharged voltage of Electabuzz, and you'll have a potent team against any foe!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Flip a coin for each {R} Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Heal 40 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
This attack does 20 damage times the number of different types of Pokémon on your opponent's Bench.
Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon. If 1 of your Pokémon used Barrier during your last turn, this attack can't be used.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon BREAK. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Choose {G}, {R}, {W}, {L}, {P}, {F}, {D}, {M}, {Y}, or {N} type. The Defending Pokémon’s Weakness is now that type until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn’t change.)
This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.
Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
This Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Discard a {R} Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Attach a {L} Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Discard all {R} Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

Discard a {R} Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.
This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.
Discard a {R} Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.
From the moment you use this attack, you must begin to sing a song. (While the song is being sung, the game continues.) When the song is finished, this attack does 30 damage.
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
This attack does 60 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
This Pokémon can't use Leek Slap during your next turn.
During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, discard an Energy attached to the Attacking Pokémon.
This Pokémon is now Confused. During your next turn, this Pokémon's Loll Roll Spin attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, you may move any number of {R} Energy attached to your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out this Pokémon and attach it to one of your {L} Pokémon as a Special Energy card. This card provides 2 {L} Energy only while this card is attached to a Pokémon.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
All Energy attached to this Pokémon are {R} Energy instead of their usual type.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Evolution Pokémon.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 2 Basic Pokémon (except for Dragonite-EX) from your discard pile into your hand.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this Ability.)
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
When this Doduo retreats, hold this card and throw it as hard as you can because Doduo is running away. Throw the card horizontally with a snap to get the farthest distance!

product.gameplay.deckbox.xy12elitetraine: Elite Trainer Mega Blastoise Deck Box
Elite Trainer Mega Blastoise Card Sleeves
Elite Trainer Mega Charizard Y Deck Box
Elite Trainer Mega Charizard Y Card Sleeves
product.xy12.booster.description: All Trainers and Pokémon grow and evolve—and this expansion restores the very first Pokémon trading cards to glory! With the exhilarating power of Mega Venusaur-EX, Mega Charizard-EX, and Mega Blastoise-EX, plus some wild surprises like Dragonite-EX, Ninetales BREAK, Machamp BREAK, and Mega Slowbro-EX, the classic hard-battling Pokémon and old-school Trainers are reinvented for a new generation. Ask Professor Oak to get you started, and reach new heights with the Pokémon TCG: XY—Evolutions expansion!
product.xy12.pcd.mewtwomayhem.name: Mewtwo Mayhem
product.xy12.pcd.pikachupower.name: Pikachu Power
shop.error.leaveredeemcodes.body: Are you sure you want to leave the code redemption screen? Any codes you have entered will not be claimed, and you will have to re-enter them later.
specialvisualizations.bw9_100.frozencity: Whenever you attach an Energy from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, it will get 2 damage counters if it isn't a Team Plasma Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.cannotremovedamage: Damage counters can't be removed from any Pokémon. (Damage counters can still be moved.)
specialvisualizations.immunetoallattackd: This Pokémon is immune to damage from attacks.
specialvisualizations.increasedweaknessd: This Pokémon's Weakness has been increased.
specialvisualizations.xy12_47.littlegrud: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, an Energy attached to the Attacking Pokémon will be discarded.
specialvisualizations.xy12_51.barrier: Your Pokémon can't use the Barrier attack this turn.
specialvisualizations.xy12_53.neutralshi: This Pokémon is immune to attacks from the opponent's Evolution Pokémon.
tc.infodialog.basicdecks.body: We've given you three basic theme decks to start. Each time you win with one of those decks, you'll unlock new cards for it. Win 7 times to unlock the whole deck and add it to your collection!
tc.infodialog.overview.body: Welcome to Trainer Challenge! In this mode, you'll use theme decks to compete against AI Trainers in three different Leagues to earn rewards!
tc.infodialog.redeemed.body: Each theme deck you redeem can be played in Trainer Challenge mode. You can redeem some theme decks in the Shop using Trainer Tokens, or you can redeem code cards from a theme deck you've purchased. Winning 12 games with a redeemed theme deck gives you a booster pack!
tc.infodialog.rewards.body: Each time you defeat a Trainer with a unique deck, you'll earn a star. The first three stars reward you with Trainer Tokens. Each star you earn makes that Trainer harder to defeat the next time you play. Earn all four stars to win a booster pack! If you earn four stars on all the Trainers in a League, you'll win even more booster packs!
tpci.product.xy12.3pack.blistera.descrip:
Give Your Collection a Boost!
Get in on the latest Pokémon TCG action with three awesome booster packs, 1 special holographic promo card featuring Black Kyurem, and a cool Pokémon coin to add to your collection!

This offer runs through November 29, 2016.
tpci.product.xy12.3pack.blistera.name: XY—Evolutions 3-Pack Blister with Black Kyurem

This offer runs through December 13, 2016.
